item: Structure of the airways, pulmonary lobes and areas and the pulmonary hilum
Difference between pulmonary and systemic circulation
Structure of mediastinum and pleural cavity
Respiratory muscles and mechanisms of respiratory movement
Lung air volume fractionation, ventilation, and dead space (ventilatory mechanics (intrathoracic pressure, lung compliance, resistance, closing volume (closing volume))
Relationship between gas exchange and blood flow in the alveoli
Effect of pulmonary ventilation and blood flow (ventilation to blood flow ratio) on arterial blood gases (alveolar-arterial oxygen partial pressure gradient (A-aDO2))
Mechanisms of respiratory regulation via the respiratory center
Mechanisms of oxygen and carbon dioxide transport by blood
Airway and lung defense mechanisms (immunological and non-immunological) and metabolic functions
Respiratory function tests (spirometry, pulmonary diffusion capacity, flow-volume curve), arterial blood gas analysis, polysomnography, peak flowmetry
Imaging tests (radiography, CT, MRI), nuclear medicine tests (positron emission tomography (PET))
